meanings.definition: Fully grown and developed, as fruit.
meanings.sent1: The apple was ripe and ready to be picked.
meanings.sent2: The banana turned ripe and sweet on the tree.
meanings.sent3: The peach was so ripe, it practically jumped into my hand!
meanings.sent4: The idea was ripe for exploration, like a juicy fruit waiting to be tasted.
meanings.sent5: The tomato was perfectly ripe, bursting with flavor.

meanings.sent1: The wheat field was ripe for harvest.
meanings.sent2: The corn was ripe and golden in the autumn sun.
meanings.sent3: The strawberries were so ripe, they practically begged to be picked.
meanings.sent4: The time was ripe for celebration, like a field ready for harvest.
meanings.sent5: The grapes were ripe and plump, ready to be turned into wine.

meanings.definition: Advanced to the point of being in the best condition for use.
meanings.sent1: The cheese was ripe and flavorful, perfect for a picnic.
meanings.sent2: The opportunity was ripe for success, just waiting to be seized.
meanings.sent3: The joke was so ripe, it had everyone laughing for hours.
meanings.sent4: The market was ripe with possibilities, like a garden in full bloom.
meanings.sent5: The moment was ripe with anticipation, like a fruit about to be savored.
